description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/2429285168 at Mon May  9 07:39:23 UTC 2022

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: woodhouse Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.title: woodhouse Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

Async jobs performed by woodhouse.



### Observability Tools

* [Woodhouse Container Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Ecluster%5Fname%3D%22ops%2Dgitlab%2Dgke%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Econtainer%5Fname%3D%22woodhouse%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Enamespace%5Fname%3D%22woodhouse%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcontainer%22;timeRange=PT6H?project=gitlab-ops)

panels.title: http SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="http",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="http",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="http",monitor="global",type="woodhouse"})))),

panels.content:
### Description

HTTP requests handled by woodhouse.



### Observability Tools

* [Woodhouse Container Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Ecluster%5Fname%3D%22ops%2Dgitlab%2Dgke%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Econtainer%5Fname%3D%22woodhouse%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Enamespace%5Fname%3D%22woodhouse%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcontainer%22;timeRange=PT6H?project=gitlab-ops)
panels.title: Details
Estimated p95 async_jobs Latency - per job_name
Apdex attribution for async_jobs Latency - per job_name

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-other"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="woodhouse", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-other"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.title: Source

title: woodhouse: Overview
